instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message:
hi, on my previous post I had asked about a no backlight issue on the same <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. well before i could figure what the issue was the board decided to randomly blow a capacitor taking the <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> 3.3v/HV POWER MUX CHIP along with it so i replaced the blown capacitor along with the <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> chip. Now i only get a green light all power rails except S0 are enabled. after doing a lot of troubleshooting i believe the issue lies in between the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> which may be causing no <SIGNAL>1V5CPU_EN</SIGNAL> which is not letting the 1.5v S3/S0 FET to enable.

So ive come to ask for some help and guidance. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message: Remove <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and forget about thunderbolt, see if S0 rails come back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 28241"]Remove <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and forget about thunderbolt, see if S0 rails come back.[/QUOTE]

wow that was easy. worked. is that area shorted or why was it preventing s0?
well that got the fan spinning but now the <DIODE>D3895</DIODE> diode is smoking. im assuming i wont need it if i dont plan to fix thunderbolt guess ill remove that as well?

edit:after removing the diode the chip next to it <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> smoked as well got a partial fan spin now im back to green light i noticed the smoke coming from the side with the t29 booster pins. removed the chip now im back at spinning fan. guess thunderbolt is fucked for good? it gets extremely hot where <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> used to be.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message: Find where the heat is coming from <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> tends to short too and the caps around <CHIP>U3890</CHIP>, I hope it is not in the board.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message: cant find anything heating up out of the ordinary the heat from where <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> sits is no longer there and <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> isnt getting hot. capacitors tied to the t29 bst boosters are shorting and both pins where <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> sits are giving my meter a beep too. problem seems to lie in the booster?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message: Just remove all that crap, thunderbolt is gone anyway. <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> and the caps there can all go.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b 1.5v s3/s0 Fet
threads.message: got it, wont bother fixing thunderbolt. Thanks for the help!
